title: Mother, toddler killed in shooting in Fort Washington
content:
FORT WASHINGTON, Md. (ABC7) — Prince George's County Police have identified the mother and toddler killed in Tuesday morning's Fort Washington shooting as 26-year-old Neshante Alesha Davis and 2-year-old Chloe Nichole Davis-Green.
Police responded to a shooting in the 1300 block of Palmer Road shortly after 7 a.m. Tuesday. When officers arrived on the scene, they found Davis unresponsive and suffering from an apparent gunshot wound. She was pronounced dead at the scene.
Police said the toddler also suffered from an apparent gunshot wound and was rushed to a local hospital where she was later pronounced dead.
According to the Prince George's County Educators' Association, Davis was an educator at Bradbury Heights Elementary School.
This story has been updated
